Description: Attend energy or sustainability fair, to find ways to take sustainable action.
Helptext: Attending an energy fair is a great way to get started lowering energy use.

Description: Sign up for an energy audit, offered free from MassSave and most local utilities
Helptext: An energy audit can tell you the condition of your home and its heating and other systems, and help you address the issues found.

Description: Install programmable thermostats
Helptext: Installing and using a programmable thermostat typically saves 15% from your heating bill.

Description: Insulate or air-seal a home
Helptext: Weatherizing (insulating and air-sealing) your home typically saves 15% from your heating bill.

Description: Sign up for community solar
Helptext: Joining a community solar project can save on your your electric bill and lower greenhouse gas emissions.

Description: Switch to renewable electricity
Helptext: Choosing renewable electricity reduces or eliminates greenhouse gas emissions from the power you use.

Description: Install LED light bulbs
Helptext: Swapping out incandescent bulbs for LEDs reduces their electricity consumption by 88%.

Description: Request a heating system assessment
Helptext: Getting a heating system assessment can help find the best path for saving energy and reducing emissions.

Description: Replace boiler or furnace with a high efficiency system
Helptext: Replacing an old boiler or furnace with efficient models can save 10-15% of your heating bill.

Description: Install an air-source heat pump
Helptext: Heating and cooling with air-source heat pumps reduces emissions greatly, and can improve comfort and save energy costs.

Description: Install a ground-source heat pump
Helptext: Heating and cooling with a ground-source heat pump reduces emissions greatly, and can improve comfort and save energy costs.

Description: Request a hot water assessment
Helptext: A hot water assessment can help find out the best options for replacing a water heater to save money and reduce emissions.

Description: Install a heat pump water heater
Helptext: A heat pump water heater uses about 1/3 the energy of an electric or fossil water heater, reducing emissions and saving money.

Description: Request a solar assessment
Helptext: Getting a solar assessment can help you plan for a solar PV or solar hot water system to reduce emissions and lower cost.

Description: Install a solar PV array
Helptext: Installing a solar PV array  can reduce your carbon footprint dramatically, and save considerable money over time.

Description: Install a solar hot water system
Helptext: A solar hot water system saves considerable money and emissions.

Description: Replace refrigerator with an EnergyStar model
Helptext: Replacing a refrigerator with an EnergyStar model can save a lot of energy and money over time.

Description: Replace washing machine with an EnergyStar model
Helptext: Replacing a washer with an EnergyStar model can save a lot of energy and money over time.

Description: Install an induction stove in place of electric or gas
Helptext: An induction stove is both efficiency and great for cooking.

Description: Replace clothes dryer with a heat pump dryer
Helptext: A heat pump dryer uses much less energy than a gas or electric dryer.

Description: Wash clothes using cold or warm water
Helptext: Washing clothes in warm or cold water saves energy and money, and works as well as hot.

Description: Dry laundry on rack or clothes line
Helptext: Drying laundry on the line saves energy and money compared with a clothes dryer.

Description: Request a pickup for unused refrigerator
Helptext: Having an old, inefficient refrigerator taken away and disposed of properly saves space and keeps it from being used.

Description: Install and use a smart power strip
Helptext: A smart power strip can save on parasitic loads by shutting off devices when they aren't being used.

Description: Make use of an electricity monitor
Helptext: Using an electricity monitor to find out where power is used is a good first step to conserving it.

Description: Replace your primary vehicle
Helptext: Replacing an inefficient car with electric or hybrid can greatly lower your carbon footprint.

Description: Reduce miles driven for your primary vehicle
Helptext: Reducing the amount you drive in favor of ridesharing or public transport saves money and reduces emissions.

Description: Eliminate a vehicle
Helptext: Getting rid of a car in favor of ridesharing or public transport saves money and reduces emissions.

Description: Reduce the amount you fly
Helptext: Reducing the amount you fly has a big impact towards lowering emissions, and saves you money.

Description: Purchase carbon offsets for flights taken
Helptext: Purchasing flight offsets can reduce your carbon footprint and support efforts to restore the climate.

Description: Adopt a lower carbon diet
Helptext: Adopting a diet with less or no meat lowers emissions and can improve your health.

Description: Reduce waste in consumption and packaging
Helptext: Reducing packaging and unnecessary consumption saves money and lowers your impact.

Description: Compost food waste
Helptext: Composting food waste reduces emissions, turning garbage into valuable organic matter.

Description: Reduce the size of your lawn
Helptext: Reducing your lawn size can save money and reduce emissions and time.

Description: Reduce mowing, fertilizing or other lawn care
Helptext: Mowing, fertilizing or watering your lawn less reduces emissions and saves money.

Description: Replace gasoline mower with electric
Helptext: Switching from gasoline to electric mower reduces pollution, noise and emissions.

Description: Replace gasoline blower with rake or electric
Helptext: Raking or using an electric instead of gasoline blower reduces pollution and noise.
